html: In the same way that Isaiah is Jehovah’s voice to his people—foreshadowing Jehovah’s end-time servant—so one higher than Isaiah serves as Jehovah’s voice to Isaiah. Having ascended to the seraph level, Isaiah’s perspective broadens. He perceives how fickle people are. Without Jehovah’s Spirit to animate them the best of them resemble but fading flowers (Isaiah 5:24; 19:6-7; 37:27 ). Hence, “The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak” (Matthew 26:41 ). God’s word, as vested in his servant (Isaiah 50:4; 51:16; 59:21 ), endures forever because Jehovah stands by it (Isaiah 41:26-27; 44:26; 55:11 ).
